text: Pallacanestro Virtus Roma history and statistics in FIBA Europe and Euroleague Basketball (company) competitions. ==1980s== ===1982–83 FIBA Korać Cup, 3rd–tier=== The 1982–83 FIBA Korać Cup was the 12th installment of the European 3rd-tier level professional basketball club competition FIBA Korać Cup, running from October 6, 1982 to March 8, 1983. The trophy was won by the title holder Limoges CSP, who defeated -for second consecutive time- Šibenka by a result of 94–86 at Deutschlandhalle in West Berlin, West Germany.FIBA Korać Cup 1982/83 Overall, Banco di Roma achieved in present competition a record of 8 wins against 2 defeat, in three successive rounds. More detailed: ====First round==== * Tie played on October 6, 1982 and on October 13, 1982. |} ====Second round==== * Tie played on November 3, 1982 and on November 10, 1982. |} ====Top 16==== * Day 1 (December 8, 1982) |} * Day 2 (December 15, 1982) |} * Day 3 (January 12, 1983) |} * Day 4 (January 19, 1983) |} * Day 5 (January 25, 1983) |} * Day 6 (February 2, 1983) |} * Group A standings: {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=15|Pos. !!width=220|Team !!width=20|Pld. !!width=20|Pts. !!width=20|W !!width=20|L !!width=20|PF !!width=20|PA !!width=20|PD |- style="background: #ccffcc;" | 1. ||align=left| Limoges CSP | 6 || 11 || 5 || 1 || 503 || 482 || +21 |- style="background: #ffcccc;" | 2. ||align=left| Banco di Roma | 6 || 10 || 4 || 2 || 519 || 472 || +47 |- style="background: #ffcccc;" | 3. ||align=left| Crvena zvezda | 6 || 9 || 3 || 3 || 528 || 509 || +19 |- style="background: #ffcccc;" | 4. ||align=left| Nová huť Ostrava | 6 || 6 || 0 || 6 || 445 || 532 || -87 |} ===1983–84 FIBA European Champions Cup, 1st–tier=== The 1983–84 FIBA European Champions Cup was the 27th installment of the European top-tier level professional basketball club competition FIBA European Champions Cup (now called EuroLeague), running from September 15, 1983 to March 29, 1984. The trophy was won by Banco di Roma, who defeated FC Barcelona by a result of 79–73 at Patinoire des Vernets in Geneva, Switzerland.FIBA European Champions Cup 1983/84 Overall, Banco di Roma achieved in the present competition a record of 12 wins against 3 defeats, in five successive rounds. The trophy was won by Cibona, who defeated Real Madrid by a result of 87–78 at Peace and Friendship Stadium in Piraeus, Greece.FIBA European Champions Cup 1984/85 Overall, Banco di Roma achieved in the present competition a record of 7 wins against 7 defeats, in four successive rounds. The trophy was won by Banco di Roma, who defeated Mobilgirgi Caserta by a result of 157–150 in a two-legged final on a home and away basis.FIBA Korać Cup 1985/86 Overall, Banco di Roma achieved in present competition a record of 8 wins against 2 defeats, in five successive rounds. ====First round==== * Bye ====Second round==== * Bye ====Top 16==== * Day 1 (December 4, 1985) |} * Day 2 (December 11, 1985) |} * Day 3 (January 8, 1986) |} * Day 4 (January 15, 1986) |} * Day 5 (January 22, 1986) |} * Day 6 (January 29, 1986) |} * Group C standings: {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=15|Pos. !!width=220|Team !!width=20|Pld. !!width=20|Pts. !!width=20|W !!width=20|L !!width=20|PF !!width=20|PA !!width=20|PD !!Tie-break |- style="background: #ccffcc;" | 1. ||align=left| Banco di Roma | 6 || 10 || 4 || 2 || 547 || 500 || +47 || 1–1 (+9) |- style="background: #ffcccc;" | 2. ||align=left| Hapoel Tel Aviv | 6 || 10 || 4 || 2 || 531 || 546 || -15 || 1–1 (-9) |- style="background: #ffcccc;" | 3. ||align=left| Bosna | 6 || 9 || 3 || 3 || 581 || 584 || -3 || |- style="background: #ffcccc;" | 4. ||align=left| ESM Challans | 6 || 7 || 1 || 5 || 514 || 543 || -29 || |} ====Semifinals==== * Tie played on February 19, 1986 and on February 26, 1986. |} ====Finals==== * Tie played on March 20, 1986 at PalaMaggiò di Castel Morrone in Caserta, Italy and on March 27, 1986 at PalaEUR in Rome, Italy. |} ==1990s== ===1991–92 FIBA Korać Cup, 3rd–tier=== The 1991–92 FIBA Korać Cup was the 21st installment of the European 3rd-tier level professional basketball club competition FIBA Korać Cup, running from October 2, 1991 to March 18, 1992. The trophy was won by Il Messaggero Roma, who defeated Scavolini Pesaro by a result of 193–180 in a two-legged final on a home and away basis.FIBA Korać Cup 1991/92 Overall, Il Messaggero Roma achieved in present competition a record of 13 wins against 2 defeats plus 1 draw, in six successive rounds. The trophy was won by Philips Milano, who defeated Virtus Roma by a result of 201–181 in a two-legged final on a home and away basis.FIBA Korać Cup 1992/93 Overall, Virtus Roma achieved in present competition a record of 10 wins against 6 defeats, in seven successive rounds. The trophy was won by Aris, who defeated Tofaş by a result of 154–147 in a two-legged final on a home and away basis.FIBA Korać Cup 1996/97 Overall, Telemarket Roma achieved in present competition a record of 8 wins against 4 defeats, in five successive rounds. The trophy was won by Mash Jeans Verona, who defeated Crvena zvezda by a result of 141–138 in a two-legged final on a home and away basis.FIBA Korać Cup 1997/98 Overall, Calze Pompea Roma achieved in present competition a record of 11 wins against 3 defeats, in six successive rounds. The trophy was won by Limoges CSP, who defeated Unicaja by a result of 131–118 in a two-legged final on a home and away basis.FIBA Korać Cup 1999/2000 Overall, Aeroporti di Roma Virtus achieved in present competition a record of 10 wins against 2 defeats, in five successive rounds. The trophy was won by Maccabi Elite Tel Aviv, who defeated Skipper Bologna by a result of 118–74 at Nokia Arena in Tel Aviv, Israel.Euroleague 2003/04 Overall, Lottomatica Roma achieved in present competition a record of 4 wins against 10 defeats, in only one round. The trophy was won by Dynamo Moscow, who defeated Aris TT Bank by a result of 73–60 at Spiroudome in Charleroi, Belgium.ULEB Cup 2005/06 Overall, Lottomatica Roma achieved in the present competition a record of 8 wins against 6 defeats, in three successive rounds. The trophy was won by Panathinaikos, who defeated the title holder CSKA Moscow by a result of 93–91 at O.A.C.A. Olympic Indoor Hall in Athens, Greece.Euroleague 2006/07 Overall, Lottomatica Roma achieved in present competition a record of 7 wins against 13 defeats, in two successive rounds.
